email_content:
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for reaching out—happy to share a snapshot of our recent donor engagement metrics to help with planning the upcoming joint campaign.

Overall trends (past few years)
• Engagement has grown steadily, averaging a low-double-digit percentage increase year-over-year.
• Personalized outreach and matching-gift promotions continue to produce the highest response rates.

Recent quarter snapshot
• We saw roughly a mid-teens percentage increase in donor participation compared with the same period the previous year.
• Holiday-themed appeals were particularly effective, and an email series to lapsed supporters converted about one-fifth of recipients.

Key takeaways for our collaboration
• Combining personalized messaging with a matching-gift element could amplify responses.
• Timing a multi-channel push around a compelling moment (e.g., back-to-school) tends to create urgency.
• Segmenting lapsed supporters for a dedicated email track remains a high-return tactic.

Let me know if you’d like the full detailed report or any additional metrics—happy to provide average gift size, retention rates, or other specifics. I’m also available for a quick call to discuss how we can align these insights with Compassion in Action’s audience.

Looking forward to working together!

Best,
John
Bright Futures Foundation
sensitive_items: Michael Thompson, a consistent supporter of Bright Futures Foundation, has donated $25,000 and is interested in education technology and after-school programs.
Emily Rodriguez, a new donor, has donated $5,500 and is interested in literacy programs and teacher training workshops.
Detailed profiles of several donors, including their personal contact information, donation amounts, and specific interests in the non-profit's projects. of Donors
